column2: OREGON PERMIT TEST
column4: Oregon
column6: OR

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
column6: Drivers are not required to stop.
column8: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.
column10: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.

column2: 2. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column6: Listen to heavy metal music.
column8: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.

column2: 3. This road sign:
column4: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column6: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column8: is a no-right-turns sign.
column10: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.

column2: 4. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You continue to yawn.
column6: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column8: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.

column2: 5. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as a green light.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 6. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column4: Round
column6: Vertical rectangle
column8: Pentagon

column2: 7. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column6: Return gestures and shouts.
column8: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 8. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: the lane to the left may pass.
column6: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column8: passing is permitted in either direction.
column10: the lane to the right may pass.

column2: 9. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when following motorcycles.
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column8: when it is hard to see ahead.

column2: 10. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: riding the pedal lightly.
column6: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column8: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 11. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column6: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column10: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.

column2: 12. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column4: stop before the intersection.
column6: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.
column8: merge to the left.
column10: slow down at the traffic signal.

column2: 13. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column6: they must change lane immediately.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 14. This sign indicates:
column4: the entrance to a construction site.
column6: that you must yield the right-of-way.
column8: that you must not drive past this sign.
column10: the entrance to a dead-end street.

column2: 15. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column6: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column8: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column10: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.

column2: 16. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

column2: 17. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: must not yield to
column6: must yield to
column8: can handle

column2: 18. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian.
column6: to the pedestrian.
column8: to you.
column10: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 19. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must go to the next intersection.
column6: must turn into its right lane.
column8: can not turn left.
column10: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 20. The most common cause of traffic crashes is:
column4: human error.
column6: bad road conditions.
column8: bad weather.

column2: 21. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: go faster.
column6: slow down.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 22. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in a crosswalk.
column6: in a tunnel.
column8: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 23. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: quickly change speed or lane position.
column6: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column8: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.

column2: 24. This road sign is:
column4: a guide sign.
column6: a speed reduction sign.
column8: a warning sign.

column2: 25. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Only right turns are allowed.

column2: 26. You must stop for pedestrians:
column4: only at marked crosswalks.
column6: only if the pedestrian is on your side of the road.
column8: crossing the road at any marked or unmarked crosswalk.
column10: only if there is a walk signal for pedestrians.

column2: 27. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: High emphasis warning.
column6: School ahead.
column8: Regulatory.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 28. Bicyclists must:
column4: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column6: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column8: remain near the left edge of the road.
column10: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.

column2: 29. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column8: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: Divided highway ahead
column8: No U-Turn

column2: 31. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column6: take longer than cars to stop.
column8: are easier for the driver to operate.
column10: require more space for turning movements.

column2: 32. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column4: double solid yellow
column6: broken white
column8: solid white

column2: 33. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column6: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column8: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column10: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.

column2: 34. Before turning, you should:
column4: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.
column6: change lanes.
column8: increase your speed.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column4: No parking
column6: No left turn
column8: Divided highway
